description.para: Calls the Managed Streaming for Kafka Connect DescribeWorkerConfiguration API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Returns information about a worker configuration.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration that you want to get information about.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.KafkaConnect.Model.DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.KafkaConnect.Model.DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the WorkerConfigurationArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^WorkerConfigurationArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the WorkerConfigurationArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^WorkerConfigurationArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration that you want to get information about.

This cmdlet returns an Amazon.KafkaConnect.Model.DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse object containing multiple properties. The object can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: Returns a list of all of the custom plugins in this account and Region.

Calls the Managed Streaming for Kafka Connect CreateConnector API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Creates a connector using the specified properties.
The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. Value NONE means that no client authentication is used.
The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.
A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the connector.
A summary description of the connector.
Specifies the CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in to be triggered.
The CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out to be triggered.
The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for log delivery.
Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
Specifies whether connector logs get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3 destination.
The type of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log delivery.
The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
Specifies which plugins to use for the connector.
The S3 prefix that is the destination for log delivery.
The revision of the worker configuration.
The security groups for the connector.

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access the Amazon Web Services resources that it needs. The types of resources depends on the logic of the connector. For example, a connector that has Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions that allow it to write to the S3 destination bucket.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration.
The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.KafkaConnect.Model.CreateConnectorResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.KafkaConnect.Model.CreateConnectorResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectorName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectorName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The bootstrap servers of the cluster.
The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log delivery.
A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the connector.
A summary description of the connector.
The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for log delivery.
Specifies whether connector logs get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. Value NONE means that no client authentication is used.
The type of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the ConnectorName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^ConnectorName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
Specifies which plugins to use for the connector.
The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.
The name of the S3 bucket that is the destination for log delivery.
Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3 destination.
The S3 prefix that is the destination for log delivery.
Specifies the CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in to be triggered.
The CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out to be triggered.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.KafkaConnect.Model.CreateConnectorResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.KafkaConnect.Model.CreateConnectorResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access the Amazon Web Services resources that it needs. The types of resources depends on the logic of the connector. For example, a connector that has Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions that allow it to write to the S3 destination bucket.
The security groups for the connector.
The revision of the worker configuration.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration.
